metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3421 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the RPM package in the read functionality. This flaw allows an attacker who can convince a victim to install a seemingly verifiable package or compromise an RPM repository, to cause RPM database corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity. This flaw affects RPM versions before 4.17.0-alpha.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmbuild9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmio9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmsign9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
python3-rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-common - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-i18n - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm2cpio - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Only debugedit and librpmio9 binary packages are in main, and triaged with view to how they are used in the build process as described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rpm/+bug/1913871

criterions.comment: rpm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.17.0+dfsg1-1').
